item.title: Spectral Estimation Problem in Infinite Dimensional Spaces
item.description: arXiv:2505.09403v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We consider the generalized spectral estimation problem in infinite dimensional spaces. We solve this problem using the boundary control approach to inverse theory and provide an application to the initial boundary value problem for a hyperbolic system.
item.dc:creator: S. A. Avdonin, V. S. Mikhaylov

item.title: On some applications of the Boundary Control method to spectral estimation and inverse problems
item.description: arXiv:2505.09410v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We consider applications of the Boundary Control (BC) method to generalized spectral estimation problems and to inverse source problems. We derive the equations of the BC method for this problems and show that solvability of this equations crucially depends on the controllability properties of the corresponding dynamical system and properties of corresponding families of exponentials.
item.dc:creator: S. A. Avdonin, A. S. Mikhaylov, A. S. Mikhaylov

item.title: Limiting Absorption Principle For Long-range Perturbation In The Discrete Triangular Lattice Setting
item.description: arXiv:2403.06578v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We examine the discrete Laplacian acting on a triangular lattice, introducing long-range perturbations to both the metric and the potential. Our goal is to establish a Limiting Absorption Principle away from possible embedded eigenvalues. Our study relies on a positive commutator technique.
item.dc:creator: Nassim Athmouni (IMB), Marwa Ennaceur (IMB), Sylvain Golenia (IMB), Amel Jadlaoui

item.title: Adiabatic limits and spectral sequences for Riemannian foliations
item.description: arXiv:math/9902147v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: For general Riemannian foliations, spectral asymptotics of the Laplacian is studied when the metric on the ambient manifold is blown up in directions normal to the leaves (adiabatic limit). The number of ``small'' eigenvalues is given in terms of the differentiable spectral sequence of the foliation. The asymptotics of the corresponding eigenforms also leads to a Hodge theoretic description of this spectral sequence. This is an extension of results of Mazzeo-Melrose and R. Forman.
item.dc:creator: Jesus A. Alvarez Lopez, Yuri A. Kordyukov
